entities.departureInfo:
Pickup Details
Upon arrival at the airport you must collect your luggage and proceed to the customs hall. The driver will be waiting for you holding a sign with the lead traveler's name written on it.
Other

 
  Paris, Paris, Ile-de-France

descriptions.shortDescription: Travel from Charles de Gaulle (CDG) or Orly (ORY) International Airport to your centrally located Paris hotel (postcode beginning with 75 only). Transfer services are available for flights arriving between 4am and 11pm, 7 days a week.

entities.name: Paris Private Arrival Transfer: Charles de Gaulle (CDG) or Orly (ORY)

entities.departureInfo: Place du Trocadero, Place du Trocadéro, 75016 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Remember the victories and the losses of the D-Day landings with a tour of Normandy’s four most significant World War II sites. Visit a museum in a real German bunker on Utah Beach. Walk among memorials to 10,000 fallen at the American Cemetery, with a poignant view over Omaha Beach, where Allied forces faced terrible odds. The, experience this region’s rich culinary history with a two-course lunch and some local apple cider.

entities.name: Normandy D-Day Landing Beaches Day Trip with Cider Tasting & Lunch from Paris

entities.departureInfo: Port de la Conférence, 75008 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
See Paris from the water on a 3-hour Seine River cruise on the iconic Bateaux-Mouches, which includes dinner. You'll admire the city's elegant architecture all lit up for the evening as you pass by landmarks such as Notre-Dame Cathedral and the Eiffel Tower. When booking, select from the Prestige or Excellence menus; you also have the option to select a holiday cruise, when available (duration may differ).

Please note that for groups (more than 15 people) a unique choice of menu is compulsory.

entities.name: Bateaux Mouches Seine River Paris by Night Dinner Cruise with Live Music

entities.departureInfo: Boulevard de Clichy, Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Stroll through Paris' most bohemian neighborhood on a guided afternoon walk through Montmartre. You'll see where famous painters lived and worked in this beautiful hilltop part of Paris, with its windmills, cabarets and monuments. Begin your two-hour Paris Walking Tour of Montmartre just across the street from the most famous cabaret in the world - the Moulin Rouge. Then follow cobblestone streets to the highest point in Paris at the white Sacre Coeur Basilica, which offers breathtaking views in all directions.

entities.name: Montmartre and Sacre Coeur Walking Tour in Paris
entities.returnInfo: Sacré-Cœur, 35 Rue du Chevalier de la Barre, 75018 Paris, France

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Discover the pure beauty of Bruges in a day. From monasteries to cathedrals and palaces, you’ll be guided though the city center that well deserves its UNESCO world heritage title. Admire the splendor of original medieval architecture and enjoy the fascinating story of its history. Take in the incredible sites of the Venice of the North cruising along its romantic canals and take time out to leisurely lunch and shop. 

The city’s romantic charm and stunning architecture make this a perfect day to remember.

entities.name: Bruges Guided Visit From Paris Full Day Trip

entities.departureInfo: GetYourGuide Versailles, 10 Avenue du Général de Gaulle, 78000 Versailles, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Discover the Palace of Versailles and skip the long lines at the entrance with this 90-minute guided tour. Choose the time that better suits your program and make your own way to Versailles. Your guide will take you on an unforgettable tour of the Hall Of Mirrors and State Apartments. Stroll around the famous French gardens at your own leisure after the tour (additional entrance ticket required on musical or fountain show days).

entities.name: Versailles Palace Skip-the-line Classic Guided Tour
entities.returnInfo: Palace of Versailles, Place d'Armes, 78000 Versailles, France

entities.departureInfo: 38 Avenue de la Bourdonnais, 75007 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
With this skip-the-line Eiffel Tower entrance, take advantage one of only a few priority admission tickets to the tower that include a host and commentary, providing a hassle-free visit to one of the world’s busiest monuments. Accompanied by your host from outside the main gates to the second level, you'll enjoy a relaxing entrance at the Eiffel Tower with ample free time to wander around the viewing platforms and gaze out at Notre-Dame Cathedral, Les Invalides, and more. Then head to the tower's summit (aka 3rd level) for a rarer view, as many visitors don't go up to this additional platform. Select a time for your entry when booking.

Please make sure to arrive at our meeting point fifteen minutes before the start of your activity. Latecomers will miss out.

entities.name: Skip the Line Ticket: Eiffel Tower Summit Priority Access with Host

entities.departureInfo:
Pickup Details
Other

 
  Gare du Nord, 75010 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: The Eurostar terminal is located on the first floor of the Gare du Nord train station in central Paris. Book this private transfer for a fast and hassle-free journey between Gare du Nord and your central Paris hotel (postcode beginning with 75 only) or one of Paris' many mainline stations for travel elsewhere in France. The transfer services are available from 4am until 11pm, 7 days a week.

entities.name: Private Transfer: Gare du Nord Train Station (Eurostar Terminal)
entities.returnInfo: Paris, Paris, Ile-de-France - postcode beginning with 75 only

entities.departureInfo:
Pickup Details
You will be met at your Paris accommodation (postcode beginning 75 only) by the driver at least four (4) hours before your scheduled flight departure time, within a 20 minute window.
Other

 
  Paris, Paris, Ile-de-France

descriptions.shortDescription: Travel from your centrally located Paris hotel (postcode beginning with 75 only) to Charles de Gaulle (CDG) or Orly (ORY) International Airport. Transfer services are available from 4am until 11pm, 7 days a week.

entities.name: Paris Private Departure Transfer: Charles de Gaulle (CDG) or Orly (ORY)

entities.departureInfo: 9 Place Saint-Michel, 75006 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: The "Latin Quarter + Le Marais Bike Tour” is a truly local experience. It's for those who want to get to know Paris' hidden charms and see what makes it so captivating to the locals.

entities.name: Paris Hidden Secrets Small-Group Bike Tour

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
Enjoy a glass of bubbly as you spend a day in the famous region of Champagne on a day trip from Paris. With its magnificent vineyards, impressive heritage and world class champagnes, the region makes a great excursion from the French capital. Explore Mumm cellars (or similar), visit the Reims Cathedral the
place of coronation of the Kings of France, meet a local wine-grower and enjoy a Champagne sabrage/flying disgorgement demonstration.

entities.name: Champagne Tasting & Reims Cathedral Visit In One Day from Paris

entities.departureInfo: Paroles De Fromagers D'exceptions School Cheese À Paris, 41 Rue du Faubourg du Temple, 75010 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Cheese and wine, the perfect marriage. Master the art of pairing these two delicacies during a tasting session in an underground cheese cellar in Paris. With your guide, a professional cheesemonger, delve below Paris' busy streets to discover an underground treasure trove of maturing cheeses. Sit down to enjoy a variety of seven French and Swiss cheeses, and learn how to match them with different wines while nibbling on French bread and fruit. Numbers are limited to 10 during this small-group tasting session, ensuring a more intimate experience.

entities.name: Paris Art of Pairing Cheese and Wine Tasting in a Cheese Cellar

entities.departureInfo: Le Foodist Paris Cooking Classes Wine Tasting Food Tour, 59 Rue du Cardinal Lemoine, 75005 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Master the art of making one of France’s most delicate pastries on this 3-hour macaron-making class in Paris. With step-by-step guidance from a helpful instructor, choose from a range of vibrant colors and create your elegant meringue shells. Whisk up the soft buttercream filling then carefully pipe it in. Relax as your macarons slowly bake in the oven, then taste them with a cup of tea or coffee. Enjoy personal attention from the instructor on this small-group tour, limited to eight people. Upgrade your booking for an advanced macarons class.

entities.name: Paris Cooking Class: Learn How to Make Macarons

entities.departureInfo: Alexandre Dumas, 75011 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Visit one of the most romantic and mysterious sites in Paris on a small-group walking tour through Père Lachaise Cemetery. Numbers are limited to a maximum of 25 people on this small-group tour, ensuring you'll receive personalized attention from your knowledgeable guide.

entities.name: Paris Père Lachaise Cemetery: Famous Graves of Paris Walking Tour

entities.departureInfo: Palais-Royal, 75001 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Make sure you have plenty of amazing photos of your time in Paris with this 2-hour private photo shoot package. A professional photographer will suggest routes with awesome photo ops or follow you wherever you wish (subject to your itinerary being feasible within the duration of the tour), snapping photos of every special moment. You're sure to draw plenty of curious glances and feel like a star as you wander the streets of Paris. Afterward, you'll get between 130-150 high-quality photos sent to you by email. This is a cool and unusual way to celebrate a honeymoon or any major milestone!

entities.name: Private Paris Walking Tour with a Personal Photographer

entities.departureInfo: 14 Rue des Boulangers, 75005 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
The owner of the wine place, Thierry is a French certified sommelier ( WSET level 2 and 3) and a wine instructor for Burgundy wines. ( fluant in English)
This Wine Tasting tour In Paris is the best way to discover French Wines with an English-speaking wine expert. During more than 2 hours, without leaving Paris, you will discover the most famous wine regions of France and taste 6 excellent French wines: 1 Champagne, 1 white wine from Loire Valley, 1 white wine from Burgundy, 1 Red wine from Burgundy, 1 red wine from Bordeaux, 1 red wine from Rhone Valley.

You will also learn how to taste wine like a real wine expert. This wine tasting takes place in small groups of maximum 12 people in a charming place located in the heart of Latin Quarter.

If you want to buy a small cheese platter to pair with your wines , please tell us in the comment section  when you book (12 euros for 4 cheeses - payment on arrival)

entities.name: Wine Tasting In Paris

entities.departureInfo: 2 Avenue Kléber, 75116 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: On this unique panoramic bus tour, dine in true Parisian style while admiring top Paris attractions including the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, Notre Dame Cathedral and the Champs-Elysées. Board a glass-enclosed, double-decker bus, take a seat at your table and take in beautiful views of Paris from every angle as you dine on fine French cuisine. A 2.5-hour 6-course dinner tour.

entities.name: Luxury Paris Bus Dining Experience

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription:
This tour will take you to the heart of the Champagne country to discover the history and secrets of "The King of Wines". A small group tour to enjoy an intimate visit of one of the most beautiful regions of France. You'll visit a world-renowned champagne house and tour the historic city of Reims, the capital of the Champagne region. Numbers are limited to a maximum of 15 people on this small group tour, ensuring you'll receive personalized attention from your guide.
Enjoy a glass of bubbly as you spend a day in the famous region of Champagne on a day trip from Paris. With its magnificent vineyards, impressive heritage and world class champagnes, the region makes a great excursion from the French capital. Explore Mumm cellars (or similar), visit the Reims Cathedral the
place of coronation of the Kings of France, meet a local wine-grower and enjoy a Champagne sabrage/flying disgorgement demonstration.

entities.name: Champagne Tasting and Reims Cathedral Visit Guided Small Group Tour from Paris

entities.departureInfo: 22 Rue Jean Rey, 75015 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: Visit the beautiful home and garden that inspired the master of Impressionism, Claude Monet, on a small group half-day tour from Paris. The half-day tour is guided, also you'll have free time to explore at your own pace. Takes in Monet's restored home and garden in Giverny, and you'll also visit the Musée des Impressionnismes. Maximum of only 15 passengers on this small-group tour from Paris.

entities.name: Monet Gardens Small Group Tour From Paris

entities.departureInfo: Le Départ Saint-Michel, 1 Place Saint-Michel, 75005 Paris, France

descriptions.shortDescription: The only place in the world that is able to grow and produce Champagne is just outside of Paris. Join this small group tour and you’ll discover the growing, harvesting, bottling, and proper way of tasting Champagne. To keep the experience as intimate as possible, you will be in a group of no more than 8 people and your guide.

entities.name: Champagne Day Trip with Moet&Chandon, Reims Cathedral & Family Winery from Paris
